Comments_List: Immune system and its components, how to engineer new treatment methods
I learned updated knowledge about immunology and trained my presentation skills.

In this course, I learned how to engineer in the immune system which enables us to tune the immune system depending on designated applications. For example, for autoimmune disease setting, we learned how to specifically tune down corresponding such as effector T cells. In order to learn these skills, first, we learn the foundation of immunology. Then we applied to these foundations into an engineering discipline. Overall, in this course, I was able to learn a huge deal of information in immunology and engineering.
Expectations and schedule fluctuated too often and was unclear

Strength: The workload of the course is reasonable.

Weakness: The organization of the lecture content is confusing. The lecture notes were not uploaded in time.

Strengths
The TA and the professor were very helpful and expert in the area of immunology. Most of the topics were current diseases like cancer, allergies. And learning the pathological pathways in this class was very helpful. The professor is also dedicated to teaching current research topics which makes very helpful for us to understand what is going on currently in the area.

Weakness
-Have the class well-defined curriculum and make the readings assignments and class discussions in line with the HW and the exams so that students could actively engage with the class.
The course schedule was hectic, possibly due to extenuating circumstances. However, I would recommend based solely on content.
I would recommend this course to students who are interested in nanoparticle research.

I would recommend this class for students who are planning on going to study immunology and immunoengineering because this class was very helpful for me to understand the foundation of immunology and how to tune the immunology to make a significant impact in cancers, allergies and autoimmune diseases.
